metadata.synopsis: A Pakistani teenager living in Belgium becomes pregnant and wants to keep the baby, but her family has other plans.

reviews: A Wedding successfully develops its thematic nucleus in the comparisons between Zahira's family and her friend Aurore's. [Full Review in Spanish]
A Wedding helps visualize a worldwide problem that is still pending in this new millennium. [Full Review in Spanish]
In its best moments, A Wedding thrives in exposing the strong family repressions that a young woman of Pakistani origin endures. [Full Review in Spanish]
A Wedding is not a Middle Eastern telenovela, although there are times when it dangerously resembles one. [Full review in Spanish]

The film survives primarily, however, off the lead turn by El Arabi, who shines as Zahira. It's a rather muted, understand performance, internalised and subtle, and one she pulls off with quite remarkable consequences.
